channel.title: TFS Top Tip #3: Removing the Resolve Check-In Action from a Work Item
channel.description: I don’t know about you, but I love associating my check-ins with work items using the Pending Changes view, it makes it so easy to maintain requirements traceability and helps me feel less guilty as I’m doing one more thing...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Grant Holliday+00:00
item.description:
Your blog is just a treasure trove of information Martin.
Thanks again.
item.dc:creator: Grant Holliday

item.title: Comment by Eric+00:00
item.description: Does this only impact new projects to be created? Any way to do this on a project that's already active?
item.dc:creator: Eric

item.title: Comment by Martin+00:00
item.description:
Eric,
This will work on an existing project as well as new ones. Use the witimport.exe tool to import into an existing project. (See http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms253163.aspx) for more information in witimport.
Alternatively, if the command line is not what you like to use then try out the excellent process template editor (http://www.gotdotnet.com/workspaces/workspace.aspx?id=812a68af-5e74-48c6-9623-1a4469142a84).
Hope that helps,
Martin.
item.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by owin+00:00
item.description:
Hi Martin,
I'm trying to do the same for the Task workitem, but it does not seem to have a section. Do you know how is this done for the Task workitem?
item.dc:creator: owin

item.title: Comment by Henry Troup+00:00
item.description: I found I could do this, for both Task and Bug but the Process Editor was not reliable for removing Actions. witexport and witimport worked fine.
item.dc:creator: Henry Troup

item.title: Comment by Paras Wadehra+00:00
item.description: Where is this file that we need to modify?
item.dc:creator: Paras Wadehra

item.title: Comment by Benjamin Fallar III+00:00
item.description: This customization is great, but is there a way just to change the default action from 'Resolve' to 'Associate' without removing the 'Resolve' item in the drop-down list?
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Fallar III

item.title: Comment by Brad Morse+00:00
item.description: Where is the XML file for the transition section from the MSF Agile Bug located? Is this VS2008 or will this also work with VS2005? Thanks.
item.dc:creator: Brad Morse
